feed.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver
feed.subtitle: Posts from Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

entry.title: Hundreds marched in Denver today alongside cities across the...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Hundreds marched in Denver today alongside cities across the U.S. to demand citizenship and full rights for all immigrants NOW!

In honor of the historic Day Without an Immigrant on May 1, 2006 -- in which millions of immigrant workers and their allies marked International Workers' Day with strikes, walkouts, boycotts, and mass demonstrations -- today's marchers wore white shirts and retraced the steps of the original march route that took place in Denver fifteen years ago, ta...king over the street from Viking Park in Northwest Denver to the center of the city.

Before the march, immigrants representing cities and towns all across Colorado spoke out against the cruel deportations, detentions, and exploitation facing millions of undocumented and other immigrant workers in this country.

The message was militant, determined and clear: NOW is the time! Congress and President Biden must:

• Create a pathway to citizenship for all 11+ million undocumented immigrants!
• Ensure that a pathway to citizenship is included in the reconciliation bill, and pass it!
• Welcome all refugees and asylees including those from Afghanistan, Haiti, and Central America, and work to provide them a pathway to citizenship
• Stop all deportations, detentions, and family separations in our immigrant communities!

Exigiremos lo siguiente al Congreso y Biden:

• ¡Cree un camino hacia la ciudadanía para los más de 11 millones de inmigrantes indocumentados!
• ¡Asegúrese de que se incluya un camino hacia la ciudadanía en el proyecto de ley de reconciliación, y páselo!
• Dar la bienvenida a todos los refugiados y asilados, incluidos los de Afganistán, Haití y América Central, y trabajar para proporcionarles un camino hacia la ciudadanía.
• ¡Detengan todas las deportaciones, detenciones y separaciones familiares en nuestras comunidades de inmigrantes!

entry.title: March for Citizenship happening now! We are demanding that...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

March for Citizenship happening now! We are demanding that Congress and Biden:

- Create a pathway to citizenship for all 11+ million undocumented immigrants!
- Ensure that a pathway to citizenship is included in the reconciliation bill, and pass it!
- Welcome all refugees and asylees including those from Afghanistan, Haiti, and Central America, and work to provide them a pathway to citizenship...
- Stop all deportations, detentions, and family separations in our immigrant communities!

*******************************************

Exigiremos lo siguiente al Congreso y Biden:

- ¡Cree un camino hacia la ciudadanía para los más de 11 millones de inmigrantes indocumentados!
- ¡Asegúrese de que se incluya un camino hacia la ciudadanía en el proyecto de ley de reconciliación, y páselo!
- Dar la bienvenida a todos los refugiados y asilados, incluidos los de Afganistán, Haití y América Central, y trabajar para proporcionarles un camino hacia la ciudadanía.
- ¡Detengan todas las deportaciones, detenciones y separaciones familiares en nuestras comunidades de inmigrantes!

See MoreColorado People's Alliance was live.

We are at the #MarchForCitizenship! We're marching from Viking Park to the Auraria Campus demanding a pathway to citizenship for all undocumented Americans, welcome all refugees & asylees and put a stop to all deportations, detentions & family separations✊🏽

entry.title: "A total of 96 officers have parted ways with the Aurora...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

"A total of 96 officers have parted ways with the Aurora Police Department so far in 2021, with another two staffers expected to split by week’s end. ... The number of exits among APD ranks through the middle of September already dwarfs totals from last year, when 87 officials left Aurora police — a 61% increase over 2019. Resignations are the driving force behind the exodus"

While Aurora's situation is even more acute due to the intense condemnation the department has earned itself, this is a trend police departments are experiencing nationwide. The veneer that the police protect and serve the people of this country is slipping and the scrutiny police now know to expect is driving many would-be cops from signing up.

The mass movement against racist police terror is causing historic shifts. The fight only continues!

“For 21 months we have been in the spotlight — some for our own doing and I’m not trying to defend any of the individuals that I’ve held accountable or terminated — but it has been a very rough go to wear the Aurora police patch,” said Chief Vanessa Wilson.

sentinelcolorado.com

Aurora police report record officer departures in 2021 - Sentinel Colorado

“For 21 months we have been in the spotlight — some for our own doing and I’m not trying to defend any of the individuals that I’ve held accountable or terminated — but it has been a very rough go to wear the Aurora police patch,” said Chief Vanessa Wilson.“For 21 months we have been in the spotlight — some for our own doing and I’m not trying to defend any of the individuals that I’ve held accountable or terminated — but it has been a very rough go to wear the Aurora police patch,” said Chief Vanessa Wilson.

entry.title: This is on the homepage of the Washington Post right now. The...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

This is on the homepage of the Washington Post right now.
The Aurora Police Department is being exposed to the whole country for their brutality, racism, and corruption. This is the work of the people!! 👏 These investigations were only opened after the people made it clear that the unchecked abuse and impunity of APD would not be tolerated any longer. It was only under the pressure of mass, sustained protests that local and state politicians began to talk about investigating APD.

entry.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver“We’re prepared to seek a court-ordered solution to these problems,” Weiser...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver“We’re prepared to seek a court-ordered solution to these problems,” Weiser said.

sentinelcolorado.com

Colorado AG excoriates Aurora police and firefighters for systematically abusing residents and minorities - Sentinel Colorado

“We’re prepared to seek a court-ordered solution to these problems,” Weiser said.“We’re prepared to seek a court-ordered solution to these problems,” Weiser said.

entry.title: BREAKING: State investigation finds racism and excessive force...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

BREAKING: State investigation finds racism and excessive force rampant within Aurora Police Department

AG Phil Weiser began his press conference saying, "Last summer we heard loudly and clearly, the people of Colorado expect more from law enforcement."

The exposure and accountability now facing APD and others involved in brutalizing and abusing the people of Aurora is unparalleled in Aurora's history. It was the people who forced this change by coming together by the thousan...ds, month after month, demanding it.

The people have the power to change our society. This is only the beginning!

entry.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverThe 12 remaining charges against Joel Northam, Lillian House and Terrence Roberts were dropped...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverThe 12 remaining charges against Joel Northam, Lillian House and Terrence Roberts were dropped close to a year after their arrest. The decision comes weeks after the indictment of three police officers and two paramedics for the murder of Elijah McClain

peoplesdispatch.org

All charges dropped against activists who fought for justice for Elijah McClain : Peoples Dispatch

The 12 remaining charges against Joel Northam, Lillian House and Terrence Roberts were dropped close to a year after their arrest. The decision comes weeks after the indictment of three police officers and two paramedics for the murder of Elijah McClainThe 12 remaining charges against Joel Northam, Lillian House and Terrence Roberts were dropped close to a year after their arrest. The decision comes weeks after the indictment of three police officers and two paramedics for the murder of Elijah McClain

entry.title: “It reaffirms the principle of when you fight, you don’t...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“It reaffirms the principle of when you fight, you don’t know whether or not you’re gonna win or lose the fight, but you know if you don’t fight, you’ve already sealed the deal that you lost,” said Northam.

A trio of Aurora protester leaders, who once faced decades in prison on felony charges stemming from demonstrations last summer over the death of Elijah McClain, had a dozen remaining counts dismis…

denverpost.com

Remaining charges dropped against Aurora protest leaders

A trio of Aurora protester leaders, who once faced decades in prison on felony charges stemming from demonstrations last summer over the death of Elijah McClain, had a dozen remaining counts dismis…A trio of Aurora protester leaders, who once faced decades in prison on felony charges stemming from demonstrations last summer over the death of Elijah McClain, had a dozen remaining counts dismis…

entry.title: "As the cry for accountability in McClain's death...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

"As the cry for accountability in McClain's death increased, so did demands that the charges against the protesters be dropped. Leaders from across the country joined in the National Committee for Justice in Denver, warning that continued prosecution of the activists for leading peaceful demonstrations against those in power would strike a blow to First Amendment protections everywhere in the country.

"We made it clear from the beginning that we were not going to take a plea deal," Lucero says in a recording made on Breakthrough News earlier today. And as the defendants went through dozens of court dates, slowly the charges were dropped."

They'd been arrested on September 17.

westword.com

Last Charges Dropped Against Elijah McClain Protest Leaders

EXCLUSIVE: All Charges Dropped Against Denver Anti-Racist Activists #JusticeForElijahMcClain

In a remarkable turn of events, all charges have been dropped against Denver anti-racist activists Lillian House, Joel Northam, Eliza Lucero and Terrance Rob...In a remarkable turn of events, all charges have been dropped against Denver anti-racist activists Lillian House, Joel Northam, Eliza Lucero and Terrance Rob...

entry.title: BREAKING: ALL remaining charges against the leaders of the...
entry.content:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

BREAKING: ALL remaining charges against the leaders of the protests for Elijah McClain have been dropped! Tune into BreakThrough News NOW for an exclusive live interview with targeted organizers Joel Northam, Lillian House, and Eliza Lucero: https://youtu.be/V6-Jm5epvIk

That not a single charge of the original 69 stands today represents a tremendous victory. The resources that went into this campaign are colossal: The Aurora Police Department concocted affidavits over 30 page...s long against the activists; they used informants and fabricated evidence against them; they surveilled them; they secured warrants to break into their phones and social media accounts. Today’s complete victory shows that even when facing powerful forces of repression, the unified struggle of the people can win.

Thank you to everyone who has supported the defense of these organizers. The amazing response from across the country and around the world has been decisive in getting us to this point today.

Please read the full statement of the National Committee for Justice in Denver at https://www.denverdefense.off/all_charges_dropped
